Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Ravi Vaidyanaat Šivãchãriar, spiritual leader at The Hindu Temple Society of North America 45-57, Bowne Street, Flushing, New York 11355.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Koo.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Ravi Vaidyanaat Sivachariar, spirtual leader at the Hindu Temple Society of North America at 45-57 Bowne Street, Flushing, N.Y. 11355.

Council Member Koo moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of June 30, 2020 and July 28, 2020 be adopted as printed by Council Member Vallone.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Vallone moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of June 30, 2020 and July 27, 2020 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Chair of the Land Use Committee (Council Member Salamanca, Jr.):
Pursuant to Sections 11.20(b-d) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on related Application Nos. C 190297 ZSK and C 160146 MMK (Industry City) shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related to Application Nos. C 190296 ZMK and N 190298 ZRK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Industry City, Brooklyn (C 190297 ZSK, C 160146 MMK, C 190296 ZMK and N 190298 ZRK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Rivera:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the action City Planning Commission on Application No. C 200077 ZSM (3 St. Mark’s Place) shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 3 St. Mark’s Place, Manhattan (C 200077 ZSM)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling on Congress to pass, and the President to sign, the “All Dependent Children Count Act” (H.R. 6420) and the “All Dependents Count Act” (S. 3652), bills that would extend the 2020 recovery rebates of the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act to qualifying children over the age of 16.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: All Dependent Children Count Act” (H.R. 6420) and the All Dependents Count Act (S. 3652)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring veterinarians to provide information on adverse events associated with an animal drug on the container of such drug
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring veterinarians to provide information on adverse events associated with an animal drug on the container of such drug.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to restore funding to the United States Army Corps of Engineers’ New York-New Jersey Harbor and Tributaries Focus Area Feasibility Study, and the States of New York and New Jersey to advance their shares of the next phase of funding to revive the study until it is fully restored by the Congress.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Congress to restore funding to the United States Army Corps of Engineers’ New York-New Jersey Harbor and Tributaries Focus Area Feasibility Study.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a citywide incident management system
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Establishing a citywide incident management system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Department of Justice to implement the Death in Custody Reporting Act of 2013 in accordance with the December 2016 implementation plan and make the data accessible to the public.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Death in Custody Reporting Act of 2013

Items.MatterName: Expand language access to the NYS Board of Elections and Dept of Motor Vehicles’ telephone and online voter registration services.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Authorize the expansion of the interest rate relief.

Items.MatterName: Postponing the NYC 2020 tax lien sale until one year after the COVID-19 state of emergency has been lifted. (S.8921)

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Mr. Williams) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore

The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Mr. Williams).

There are 49 Council Members marked present for this virtual Stated Meeting.

At the time of this virtual Stated Meeting, there was one vacant seat in the Council (37th District, Brooklyn) 
pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of a General Election to be held on November 3, 2020.
The Public Advocate (Mr. Williams) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point, the Public Advocate (Mr. Williams) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Public Advocate (Mr. Williams) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, September 16, 2020.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
The Public Advocate (Mr. Williams) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 1982-A, 38-9-0 Negative: CMs Barron, Kallos, Lander, Menchaca, Powers, Reynoso, Richards, Rivera, and Van Bramer.

Int. No. 2043-A, 44-3-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

Int. No. 2054-A, 44-3-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

Res. No. 1394, 46-0-1 - Abstain: CM Yeger.

LU No. 628 & Res. No. 1411, 46-1-0 - Negative: CM Barron.

LU No. 629 & Res. No. 1412, 46-1-0 - Negative: CM Barron.

CMs Cornegy and Miller are considered Present but Not Voting (PNV) for all items coupled on the General Order Calendar at today's Stated Meeting.

See files for individual votes.
